lines.text: My Mama never gave me no real name. B.T. stands for 'Boy Ten.'

[after receiving an eviction notice]
I ought to burn this place to the ground right now.
I'm being evicted from my home, and I don't know what to do.
I see... Of course you've applied to Welfare.
I won't take Welfare. I'm not indigent. I'm not poor. I... I just run out of money.
Perhaps one of the women in the parish will take you in... at least for a time.

And then what? For thirty-five years, I've haven't missed a Sunday Mass. Every year, Easter duty. A dollar in every collection plate that was passed. And I come to you for help, and you tell me that "some woman in the parish" might take me in for a while?
In serious cases, I've been authorized to allocate fifty dollars...
Take the fifty dollars. It's what I can do.

[after being injected with penicillin]
You're damn good with that needle, ya know 'at, White Mama.
